titleStmt.title: Ferdinand E. DeCoursey to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12102

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
Head Quarters 13' U. S. Infantry,
Newport Barracks, Ky.,
June 17th, 1864.
Sir:
I have the honor to enclose herewith Consolidated Tri-monthly Report of Men Enlisted into the 13' Infantry, (Regular Army) from the state of Kentucky, from the 1st to the 10th day of June, 1864.

I am, Sir,
Very Respectfully,
Your Obedt Servt
Ferd. E. de Coursey,
1st Lieut & Adjt 13' Infantry,
Actg Supt Reg'tl Rec'tg Service.

To His Excellency,
The Governor of the state of Kentucky,
Frankfort, do.

De Courcy E.
1st Lt 13th U S Inft
Sends Tri-monthly Report of enlistments into Regular Army from Ky. from June 1st to June 10th 1864.

L B No 4 -- 1864 P. 382
Recd A. G. O June 24. 1864
